page.title: 14Village Leisure Activities
page.content: There are many active societies. Carpet bowls and badmington are played regularly in the village hall. There is a darts club at the hotel and childrens games and cricket are played on the hough. The women have an active W.R.I. There are many keen gardeners in the Horticultural Society which has a flourishing annual flower show, which also displays a lot of baking & craft work. There is also a Garvald Onion society. The Village Society organises an annual Christmas dinner and discusses village amenities The Village Hall Committee controls the activities in the hall and has occassional dances, socials etc. to raise funds. The Community Council represents both Garvald & Morham & deals with relationships with the district regional councils. Activities are held to raise money for charities.
